page.title: 02TOURISM IN SOUTH DEVON
page.content: In the summer the amount of traffic on the lanes of the South Hams increases dramatically.Most of this is holiday traffic,so we decided to ask visitors about their trip here.We interviewed people who stopped their cars at Battisborough Cross.Our first question was,why had they stopped?Some had stopped to go to the Post Office,some to park their cars,but most had paused to ask the way or to consult a map! None were actually visiting the Cross. The most popular destination was Mothecombe Beach (about 1 mile away), then Newton Ferrers and Noss Mayo (picturesque villages on the Yealm estuary,4 miles West),whilst some were just out for a drive.About half the visitors were from the Plymouth area,and the other half from elsewhere.One car had come from
